Q: AWS AppConfig Agent local development mode - how do I install the agent for local development? A:

According to AWS document, the appconfig agent only works in :

  • AWS Lambda

  • Amazon EC2

  • Amazon ECS and Amazon EKS

It's side-car mode, so the best way to test is to deploy your code to your test environment.

But, if you insist want to debug on your local machine, for me, I noticed that AWS CLI is still functional it mean that you can retrieve latest configuration by using the AWS CLI tools.

In that case, we could write a light-weight python script to start a server on your local machine, and mock the AWS AppConfig Agent behavior, and process request like this:

http://localhost:2772/applications/YOUR_APP/environments/ENV/configurations/CONFIG_NAME

Q: How to convert DOS/Windows newline (CRLF) to Unix newline (LF) A:

This one should work for everyone to convert each file in current folder on Unix or wsl

CRLF to LF

while read item; do sed -i $'s/\r$//' $item; done <<< $(find ./ -not -type d -exec file "{}" ";" | grep CRLF | awk -F ":" '{print $1}')

LF to CRLF

while read item; do sed -i $'s/$/\r/' $item; done <<< $(find ./ -not -type d -exec file "{}" ";" | grep -v CRLF | awk -F ":" '{print $1}')
